quotes: Even before the referendum in 1999, which ultimately led to separation from Indonesia, Ms. Pires was involved in working with local and global actors to plan the future of Timor Leste.

In the 1990s, she served as Xanana Gusmao’s key coordinator, organizing Timorese internationals to work with the World Bank and the United Nations in order to develop a plan of action in the event of independence.

In January 2009, I had the fortune to interview Minister Pires about the various roles she played, the constraints she faced, and the policy space she was able to create as a political actor in a country emerging from war.
Ramos Horta started it in 1998. I think it was ‘98, October ‘98.
Ramos Horta started it in 1998. I think it was ‘98, October ‘98.

Emilia Pires played a leading role in Timor Leste’s transition to independence.
I was actually the operator and I was based in Melbourne.
